lead_paragraph: A California congressman has joined the cause against Falcons quarterback Michael Vick, writing a letter yesterday that urged N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell to “act swiftly and forcefully” if Vick was involved in dog fighting on his former property.The congressman, Representative Tom Lantos, Democrat of California, is a senior member of the Oversight and Government Reform Committee. He raised the prospect of government intervention if the N.F.L. failed to discipline Vick. “I am outraged that one of the National Football League’s superstars is affiliated with such a heinous enterprise,” Lantos wrote.
